p: Other types of interference can occur between memory B cells and de novo immune responses that are unrelated to birth year but can cause the immune system to become hyperfocused on familiar epitopes, leaving the host unprepared against a drifted strain [ 40]. As a case in point, impaired immune responses after routine annual vaccination may arise from repeat exposure to highly similar antigens. This phenomenon has been observed across a broad range of age groups and, hence, is distinct from birth year imprinting [ 40, 45].
